overview_of_class: This course is designed to provide a theoretical background on the propagation of elastic stress waves in solids with periodic variation in geometry or elastic properties, a review of experimental techniques for actuation and detection of elastic waves, and an overview of state-of-the art applications of wave propagation in linear and nonlinear periodic media.
name: Selected Topics in Civil Engineering
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 495-0-20 Selected Topics in Civil Engineering

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is designed to provide a theoretical background on the propagation of elastic stress waves in solids with periodic variation in geometry or elastic properties, a review of experimental techniques for actuation and detection of elastic waves, and an overview of state-of-the art applications of wave propagation in linear and nonlinear periodic media.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: The course content is tailored to senior undergraduate and graduate students majoring in civil engineering, mechanical engineering, applied mathematics, and physics.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Geschwindner, Lou. Unified Design of Steel Structures. 2E Student Value Edition. Wiley, 2012

ISBN-13: 978-0470444030

subject: CIV_ENV

overview_of_class: Principles and practice of using aerial photographs to obtain information about natural features of the earth's surface, with emphasis on earth materials. Landforms, geological processes, rocks, and soils. Stereoscopic photographs, elements of photogrammetry. Project required in addition to lab and home work.
name: Selected Topics in Civil Engineering
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 495-0-38 Selected Topics in Civil Engineering
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Graduate Students.
Add Consent: Instructor Consent Required

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Principles and practice of using aerial photographs to obtain information about natural features of the earth's surface, with emphasis on earth materials. Landforms, geological processes, rocks, and soils. Stereoscopic photographs, elements of photogrammetry. Project required in addition to lab and home work.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Way, D.S., Terrain Analysis: Site Selection Using Ariel Photographs, McGraw Hill, 1978. (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $60).
Photographs from Way duplicated with high resolution to permit proper 3D display (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $30)
Course Handouts (Photocopied at Quartet, approximately $10)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Hamblin, W. & Howard, J. Exercises in Physical Geology, Ninth Edition

subject: CIV_ENV
